results.title: Intermediate French

results.description:
French virtual interactive sessions using ZOOM to build your skills in using French. We meet weekly on Thursdays at 0050 GMT or 10:50 AEST.  Please also note that internet connections and bandwidth do impact some users and I commence the meeting 10 minutes prior to allow people to link in.  

We aim to provide a safe learning environment where everyone is welcome and there are no expectations on what level of French members have. We challenge ourselves but do so in a friendly and supportive way and we have fun in doing so. 

We now offer a more advanced sub-group for those with more advanced french so our little french loving group continues to evolve and respond to members. 

A tip for groups going forward is to have a translator like Reverso open as you can check any grammar and even pronunciation on the spot. This is the link: https://context.reverso.net/translation/french-english/. 

I also use either my hard cover dictionary and I am now using La Conjugaison an app when I am doing my french generally - so I've stopped guessing at last! I'd recommend it or something similar as it gives all tenses for thousands of verbs. http://www.la-conjugaison.fr/

Progressively the lessons do not offer an English translation for the vignettes, so there is plenty of french there to practice with speaking in your groups. 

Please remember we set the pace for these lessons but to progress as a group it is our aim to all be progressing at the same rate. This then allows for wider group discussion on topics everyone has covered.

We use breakout rooms, to maximise learning and participation, and we endeavour to have one of our regulars in each one.  As host I visit each one to assist where needed.
results.title: Groupe de France - Brisbane Duolingo

results.description:
Rejoignez-nous pour pratiquer et améliorer votre français. 
Nous lirons un court texte et en discuterons en français.
Cette leçon est pour le niveau intermédiaire, 30 minutes.
Bienvenue!
results.title: Le français : Lire&Discuter

results.description:
All levels are invited to explore various artists from francophone countries with us. Attendees are encouraged to be curious about the music, the lyrics and the artists themselves.
While one can easily auto translate the lyrics to the songs, we encourage you to explore the French on your own before doing that. It will give you a more rich understanding of what the artist is communicating and possibly reveal times when the artist is playing with the French language for effect. 


First 10-15 minutes:  Let’s introduce ourselves!  
-This will be in small groups depending on the size of the group
Second 10-15 minutes: Small Topic Presentation/Prompts
Third 10-15 minutes: Go into different breakout rooms to discuss the topic
Final 10-15minutes:  Come back to the main room and wrap up together.


***Age limit: 18 years or older, or accompanied by legal guardian if under 18.***
If a guardian can briefly appear to grant permission to attend then someone under 18 yrs may join us.

My events often fill up fast! I do open more space the week of the event and I do so just before I send out my weekly email (date varies). I wait until the week of the event to minimize RSVPs from those who do not actually attend or who are merely seeking XP. If you would like to receive this email, please send me a message.

results.description:
The problem with language learning is always the same: the lack of opportunities to practice the language you are studying.

Easy solution? Join us at our casual French Language Exchange Online Meetup!

EVENT DESCRIPTION - WHAT

The event consists in a VERY CASUAL language exchange in French, where you will have the opportunity to chat with native speakers as well as with other people that are learning the language.

LET'S START - HOW TO JOIN

After joining our Discord Server you'll see a few rooms on the left side of the screen with many different languages (yes, it is a multilingual event). Look for the German Practice Rooms, they are simply called FRANÇAIS 1, FRANÇAIS 2, FRANÇAIS 3 and so on.. join one of the rooms and start practicing French right away

ABOUT THIS EVENT - A FEW SIDE NOTES

1) The event is meant to be CONVERSATION PRACTICE don't expect a teacher, DO expect some nice people from all over the world to make friends with.

2) This is a multilingual event. In case you want, you can practice other languages as well(in different rooms).

3) Despite the server being always online, the event is once per week, every Thursday night starting from 7pm CET. Please check your local time.

4) This group is open to adults 18 and over.

- Want to know more about the event host?

I am a language coach, in love with traveling and constantly learning some new foreign language. More information about me on Simonepols.com.

- Want to join our language exchange facebook group to be up to date with our events?

Find us HERE. Looking forward to meeting you!
Simone
results.title: VERY CASUAL FRENCH LANGUAGE EXCHANGE EVENT

results.description:
Salut! 

This event will be an online discussion on Zoom that's open to intermediate/advanced French speakers. 45 to 55 min.
I encourage everyone to participate and try not to be self-conscious about speaking! We're here to learn from each other. 
Quick round of intro (10 min) then I’ll guide this open discussion with one main topic: YOUR STORY !
Find a short story to share with us and we can discuss about it!
It can be personal, from an article or maybe your heard about it recently..  
You can even create it! It's gonna be fun and casual!
Duolingo Events are free to attend.

Tips are always appreciated.
Sent via VENMO to @Jean-Sourbe or ZELLE to (929) 217-6333
MERCI BEAUCOUP!

results.description:
Salut! 

This event will be an 45 min online discussion/debate on Zoom that's open to intermediate French speakers. 
I encourage everyone to participate and try not to be self-conscious about speaking! We're here to learn from each other.
Quick round of intro (10 min) then I’ll guide this open discussion about cinéma and the movie/Tv Show you've seen.

Here is some good movies I recommend to watch for this week:
April and the Extraordinary World (2015)
>The Artist (2011)
>Sink or Swim (Le grand bain, Gilles Lellouche, 2018)
>Polisse (Maïwenn, 2011)
>Faces, Places (Visages Villages, Agnès Varda, 2017)
>The toy (Le jouet, 1976)
>The big blue (Le grand bleu)
>What's in a Name? (Le prénom)
>The Dinner Game (le dîner de cons, 1998, on AMAZON)
>La Haine (1995)
>The Fifth Element (1997) 
>Defending your life (1991)
>Jojo Rabbit (2019)
>La grande vadrouille (1966)
> Ask me for more ...........

But you can pick up the movie or tv Show you want (doesn't have to be french) and tell us about it. It's gonna be fun and casual!
You can prepare a couple of trailers, videos or movie extracts for the event if you like!

Duolingo Events are free to attend.
Please note that our event is based on New York City: Eastern Standard Time.

Tips are always appreciated.
Sent via VENMO to @Jean-Sourbe or ZELLE to (929) 217-6333
MERCI BEAUCOUP!

results.description:
***Age limit: 18 years or older, or accompanied by legal guardian if under 18.***

As your safety and well-being are the most important to us, we will be having this event virtually. This may also make it possible for more folks to join in on the fun!

This meeting will take place in French and in English as it is geared for French beginners; or les débutants.

This will be a relaxed space to all to try out their new skills, dust off their old ones and to connect with other local French speakers!


We are now working on the passé composé with regular –ER verbs. Think of a few activities that you did over the weekend! We will share about them in small groups (for 11/5). Passé composé basics https://frenchpasttenseverbs.wordpress.com/the-basics-of-passe-compose-past-tense/ French Grammar: Passé Composé with [AVOIR] – Regular Verbs https://www.leaflanguages.org/french-grammar-passe-compose-avoir-regular-erirre-verbs/ ***Age limit: 18 years or older, or accompanied by legal guardian if under 18.*** If a guardian can briefly appear to grant permission to attend then someone under 18 yrs may join us. My events often fill up fast! I do open more space the week of the event and I do so just before I send out my weekly email (date varies). I wait until the week of the event to minimize RSVPs from those who do not actually attend or who are merely seeking XP. If you would like to receive this email, please send me a message.
results.title: San Diego French - Beginner Thursdays, 60min+/-

results.description:
需填表预订座位才可参加！Registration REQUIRED 

“我知道怎么读英文单词 “Problem”， 但是同样意思的法语单词 “Problème” 我就不知道知道怎么读了~”
“中文拼音有四个声调，但是法语怎么也有啊~ “é ê è e ë” 搞得我头好大”
“等等， 法语的那个很奇特的字母 “œ” 难道不是 “o+e” 的组合吗？”
如果您也有这些问题，那么您可以花 ￥8 (如果你抢购还可能是 ￥4 或者免费)
听一节来自法国里昂的外教的法语音标课。这个音标课的神奇之处不只是便宜的价钱，更神奇的是据同学们反应，听完这个课后就感觉可以开口讲法语了。

results.description:
All Learners of French from Zero to Hero are invited to join us for our weekly beginner workshops that include listening, speaking, reading, and writing tips, basic conversation classes, and the occassional tutorial on how to make learning fast, and fun with the help of our Sunshine Language Academy Tutors.

The Rendez-vous is 45 minutes long with an extra 15 minute buffer for Q&As or extended workshops.

To receive extra activity and bonus access to additional meetings in the week, you may wish to become a student or a member with us by visiting one of the links down below:

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/slatutors/
results.instructions_to_join: **Making an RSVP is merely showing an expression of interest. To gain access to the online webinar link - visit our website using the provided link to receive FREE access to the event.

https://www.meetup.com/Language-Speaking-Clubs/events
results.title: French for beginners

results.description:
Join us for a virtual meeting to practice your French conversation skills with your native-speaking host and a group of local learners. All levels are welcome and we will have specific activities ready for all levels. Reserve your spot and we’ll see you soon!

Note: Attendees under 18/21 must be accompanied by an adult.

Our group welcomes everyone who has a desire to speak French and build friendships. We do not discriminate in anyway, but would like to make you cognisant of what to expect from attending the meetings. The speaking levels vary, but we are not a group intended for those who have never been exposed to speaking or learning in French. We are also not an advanced group of speakers. We fall in the space of lower intermediate to advanced intermediate speakers. Our group is about having an opportunity to practice speaking French and making connections. We do not have a super structured agenda and we do not want to be teachers of French grammar. We look forward to seeing you and welcoming you to an inclusive group of Francophiles from around the globe! Your hosts, Lisa Madison and Trevor Delamater
results.title: French Group Meeting

results.description:
Enfance

L’enfance est l’une des périodes les plus heureuses de la vie d’une personne. La raison en est très simple. Les enfants n'ont rien à se soucier ou à s'inquiéter, n'ont presque pas de tâches ou de problèmes et peuvent passer la journée avec leurs amis.

Pensez à vos souvenirs d'enfance:

- Des drôles qui vous font encore rire
- Souvenirs effrayants
- Souvenirs de la célébration de certaines fêtes, comme Noël, Halloween, etc.
- Des souvenirs impliquant vos frères et sœurs, vos animaux de compagnie, vos jouets préférés, etc.
- Souvenirs de premières expériences, comme le premier jour d'école ou de maternelle
- Les mauvais souvenirs sont aussi des souvenirs.

Si vous avez besoin d'aide pour vous souvenir de vos enfance, pensez par exemple à vos jeux préférés, jouer au terrain de jeu, si vous aimez éclabousser dans les flaques d'eau ou peut-être faire voler des cerfs-volants, jouer avec de la craie, faire du vélo, manger une glace, aller à la maison de votre grand-mère, etc.

L'enfance est la période la plus heureuse de notre vie parce que lorsque vous êtes enfant, tout vous frissonnez, vous apprenez et vous comprenez le monde qui vous entoure.

1. Décrivez votre enfance, pensez-vous avoir une enfance heureuse ?
2. Décrivez en détail l'un de vos premiers souvenirs d'enfance. Quel âge pensez-vous avoir ?
3. Quelles étaient vos émissions de télévision ou vos dessins animés préférés lorsque vous étiez enfant ?
4. Pouvez-vous énumérer des choses qui vous rappellent des souvenirs de votre enfance ? Par exemple, une sorte de nourriture, une saveur spécifique, une odeur évocatrice ou une chanson ?
5. Qui était votre meilleur ami d'enfance ?
6. À quels jeux as-tu joué ?
7. Quelles sont certaines des histoires pour enfants que vous avez le plus aimées ?
8. Vous souvenez-vous d'un événement de votre enfance qui vous a rendu anxieux ou effrayé ?

Lien:
Les 5 blessures de l'enfance | La Carologie | TEDxIMTLilleDouai
https://youtu.be/8XEFSKnnrxI
results.title: L'Enfance | Duolingo Caracas

results.description:
Entre em nosso grupo de WhatsApp para mais informações: https://chat.whatsapp.com/GGA6IfLaEIb6I2CWZdmnmJ O encontro ocorre todos os sábados nas mesas em frente ao Subway, dentro da área central cercada da praça de alimentação do Partage Shopping Campina Grande, das 15 às 18 horas.
